law.text: The proper operation of democratic government requires that a public official be independent and impartial; that government policy and decisions be made through the established processes of government; that a public official not use public office to obtain private benefits; that a public official avoid action which creates the appearance of using public office to obtain a benefit; and that the public have confidence in the integrity of its government and public officials.
law.history: Created 1993 (1st Extra. Sess.) Ky. Acts ch. 4, sec. 2, effective September 16, 1993.
